title: Video captured from Space Station shows Earth bathed in intense green aurora - India Today
summary:
Video Captured from Space Station Shows Earth Bathed in Intense Green Aurora

Published On: Jan 7, 2025 | Source: India Today

Nasa astronaut Don Pettit has captivated audiences worldwide with a stunning video showcasing the vibrant green auroras from the International Space Station (ISS).

  • The video highlights the breathtaking natural light display caused by charged particles from the Sun interacting with Earth’s magnetic field.
  • It emphasizes the beauty of this celestial spectacle as seen from space.
  • The video offers a rare glimpse of the auroras typically visible in high-latitude regions.
  • Pettit’s post was captioned “Flying over aurora; intensely green,” drawing admiration on social media.
  • The ISS orbits approximately 400 kilometers above Earth, providing unique documentation opportunities.
“Flying over aurora; intensely green.” - Don Pettit

This captivating video further showcases the incredible sights that can be witnessed beyond our atmosphere, illustrating the complexity of solar activity's impact on Earth's environment.
newTitle: Video Captured from Space Station Shows Earth Bathed in Intense Green Aurora

title: HMPV virus cases live: No patients detected in Punjab, Nagpur; Officials urge ‘calm’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
No HMPV Virus Cases Detected in Punjab and Nagpur; Officials Urge Calm

Publication Date: January 7, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The recent outbreak of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) has raised concerns, but health officials in Punjab and Nagpur have reported no patients detected and are urging the public to remain calm.

  • Five HMPV cases were reported in various parts of India.
  • Health officials advise states to strengthen awareness and preventive measures.
  • Authorities confirm that HMPV is a common respiratory virus, not a new pathogen.
  • Children below three years and immunocompromised individuals are advised to exercise caution.
  • States like Odisha and Uttar Pradesh are increasing health department readiness.
“There is no need to panic, there is no such situation...so there is nothing to fear,” said Dr. Nilam Patel, Additional Director of Public Health in Gujarat.

Despite isolated cases, health officials emphasize the importance of public awareness and preparedness in dealing with respiratory illnesses.
newTitle: No HMPV Virus Cases Detected in Punjab and Nagpur; Officials Urge Calm

title: Delhi Election Live: ‘BJP is targeting my family,' alleges CM Atishi - Hindustan Times
India’s GDP growth likely slowed to 6.4% in FY25 compared to 8.2% last year: Government estimates - The Times of India
summary:
India’s GDP growth likely slowed to 6.4% in FY25 compared to 8.2% last year: Government estimates

Date: October 2023 Source: Government of India

The government estimates indicate a slowdown in India’s GDP growth, projecting a 6.4% growth for FY25, a drop from 8.2% in the previous year.

  • The growth forecast reflects concerns over global economic conditions.
  • Policy adjustments may be necessary to stimulate economic activity.
  • Investments in infrastructure and manufacturing are seen as key areas for recovery.
"The economy is experiencing headwinds, but we remain focused on recovery through targeted investments and reforms." - Government official

In conclusion, India’s economy is navigating through challenges with proactive measures needed to ensure stability and growth.
newTitle: India’s GDP growth likely slowed to 6.4% in FY25 compared to 8.2% last year: Government estimates

title: 'My fault': Sam Konstas admits provoking Jasprit Bumrah, leading to Usman Khawaja’s dismissal - The Times of India
summary:
'My fault': Sam Konstas admits provoking Jasprit Bumrah, leading to Usman Khawaja’s dismissal

Date & Source: October 2023, Times of India

Nineteen-year-old Australian cricketer Sam Konstas addressed his on-field exchange with Jasprit Bumrah during the fifth Test, downplaying the incident that led to Usman Khawaja's dismissal.

  • The confrontation arose from Bumrah's frustration with Khawaja's perceived delay.
  • Umpires had to intervene during the on-field exchange.
  • Konstas admitted his role in the incident, stating, "It was probably my fault, but it happens. It's cricket."
  • He praised Bumrah's performance and acknowledged the team's overall strong showing.
  • Konstas expressed calmness during his Test debut, managing pressure through conversations with family and teammates.
  • His performance has raised expectations for his inclusion in the Sri Lanka tour squad.
“Credit to Bumrah. He got the wicket, but obviously, great performance from the team.”

In conclusion, Konstas reflects positively on his debut and the team's successes despite the on-field tensions.
newTitle: 'My fault': Sam Konstas admits provoking Jasprit Bumrah, leading to Usman Khawaja’s dismissal

title: Galaxy Unpacked on January 22: Samsung opens pre-reservations for S25 series in India - The Financial Express
summary:
Samsung Galaxy S25 Series Pre-Reservations Open Ahead of Unpacked Event

Publication Date: January 2025, Source: Financial Express

Samsung has announced its next Unpacked event on January 22 in San Jose, California, where the new Galaxy S series will be launched. Pre-reservations for the Galaxy S25 series are now open in India.

Interested buyers in India can pre-reserve their units with a refundable token amount of Rs 2,000 to get exclusive launch offers and early access to the devices.

  • Pre-reservations for the Galaxy S25 series are live now across multiple platforms.
  • Customers pre-reserving will be eligible for benefits up to Rs 5,000.
  • The Galaxy S25 series is expected to feature Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Elite chip and enhancements in design, display, and cameras.
  • Samsung's upcoming XR headset will also be unveiled during the launch event.
“Pre-reserved customers will be eligible for early access and receive benefits of up to Rs 5,000 on purchasing the new Galaxy S series devices,” Samsung said in a press release.

This event emphasizes Samsung's push towards integrating AI and extended reality in its products, marking a significant moment for the tech giant.
newTitle: Samsung Galaxy S25 Series Pre-Reservations Open Ahead of Unpacked Event

title: Microsoft announces US $3bn investment over two years in India cloud and AI infrastructure to accelerate adoption of AI, skilling and innovation - Microsoft
summary:
Microsoft announces US $3bn investment over two years in India cloud and AI infrastructure to accelerate adoption of AI, skilling and innovation

Date: January 7, 2025 | Source: Microsoft Stories India

Microsoft has announced a significant investment aimed at enhancing AI and cloud capabilities in India, emphasizing the importance of skilling and infrastructure development.

  • Microsoft plans to invest $3 billion in India for cloud and AI infrastructure over two years.
  • The goal is to train 10 million individuals in AI skills by 2030.
  • Establishment of new datacenters to support growing AI needs in India.
“India is rapidly becoming a leader in AI innovation, unlocking new opportunities across the country.” - Satya Nadella

This investment sets the stage for India to become an AI-first nation while fostering innovation and entrepreneurship across various sectors.
newTitle: Microsoft's $3 Billion Investment to Boost AI and Cloud Infrastructure in India

title: CES 2025: Nvidia announces RTX 50 Series GPUs with 2x performance boost and DLSS 4.0 - The Times of India
summary:
CES 2025: Nvidia Announces RTX 50 Series GPUs with Major Performance Improvements

Date: January 9, 2025 Source: Tech News Today

At CES 2025, Nvidia unveiled its latest RTX 50 Series GPUs, promising a significant performance boost of up to 2x compared to the previous generation, alongside the introduction of DLSS 4.0 technology.

  • Nvidia's RTX 50 Series GPUs achieve a 2x performance increase over RTX 40 Series.
  • New DLSS 4.0 technology enhances frame rates and image quality in games.
  • The RTX 50 GPUs utilize advanced manufacturing processes for improved efficiency.
  • Nvidia expects the new GPUs to set a new standard in gaming and professional graphics.
"This is a transformative leap in GPU technology, enabling gamers to experience unprecedented performance and visual fidelity." - Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang

Overall, the introduction of the RTX 50 Series GPUs positions Nvidia as a leader in the graphics card market, ensuring that gamers and professionals alike can benefit from cutting-edge technology.

title: His favourite actor Allu Arjun beside him, 9-year-old injured in stampede remains unconscious - The Indian Express
summary:
Allu Arjun Visits Injured Boy in Hospital Following Stampede Incident

Publication Date: January 6, 2025 | Source: Indian Express

Tollywood actor Allu Arjun visited a nine-year-old boy receiving treatment after a stampede during the premiere of Pushpa 2. The boy is in critical condition, and his mother tragically died in the incident.

  • Arjun had to postpone his first visit to the boy due to police concerns regarding public interest.
  • The boy's condition is slowly improving, though he remains unconscious.
  • Doctors are cautiously optimistic about the boy's vital signs.
  • Arjun expressed his condolences to the boy’s father and offered support.
“He has remained afebrile for the last few days... his agitative episodes and dystonia have reduced but are still present.” - Dr. Chetan R Mundada

Arjun's visit aims to provide emotional support during a difficult time for the family following the tragic stampede incident.
newTitle: Allu Arjun Visits Injured Boy in Hospital Following Stampede Incident

title: Quadrant Future Tek IPO Day 1 Live Updates: Issue booked 12.10x so far, retail portion subscribed 44.38x. Check GMP | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Quadrant Future Tek IPO Day 1 Live Updates: Issue booked 13.45x so far, retail portion subscribed 48.32x. Check GMP

Date: 07 Jan, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The Quadrant Future Tek IPO, valued at ₹290 crore, has opened for public subscription with strong initial interest. The retail portion has seen significant booking, with multiple stages of interest reported throughout the day.

  • The IPO consists solely of a new issue worth up to ₹290 crore.
  • Price band set between ₹275-290 per share, open for subscription from January 7 to January 9.
  • Over ₹130 crore secured from anchor investors prior to the public subscription.
  • Retail investors subscribed 48.32 times, with total issue booked 13.45 times as of the latest updates.
  • Funds from the IPO will be used for long-term working capital needs and capital expenditures.
“The company's IPO has garnered substantial interest from retail and institutional investors, indicating strong market confidence.”

This IPO is a promising opportunity focused on India's railway safety systems and signaling technology, a sector expected to grow significantly over the coming years.
newTitle: Quadrant Future Tek IPO Day 1 Live Updates: Issue booked 13.45x so far, retail portion subscribed 48.32x. Check GMP

title: BPSC Paper Leak : Supreme Court Refuses To Entertain Plea Challenging BPSC Exam, Asks Petitioner To... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Dismisses Plea Against Bihar PSC Exam Amid Paper Leak Allegations

Date: January 7, 2024 Source: The Supreme Court of India

The Supreme Court has declined to entertain a writ petition challenging the Bihar Public Services Commission's 70th Combined Competitive Exams due to allegations of a paper leak, directing the petitioner to approach the Patna High Court instead.

  • The plea was requesting the cancellation of the 70th Combined Competitive Exams (preliminary) due to alleged paper leak issues.
  • The Supreme Court argued that it cannot be the first instance to hear such cases and advised the petitioner to move the Patna High Court.
  • Protests erupted after the paper leak allegations, with leader Prashant Kishore leading an indefinite hunger strike.
  • Around 5 lakh candidates participated in these exams at approximately 900 centers on December 13, 2024.
  • Only 10,000 candidates were allowed a re-test at one specific center where the leak allegedly occurred.
"The entire nation has seen how the Bihar Police has brutally lathy charged the protestors." - Counsel for the petitioner, Abhijit Anand

In conclusion, the ongoing situation regarding the alleged paper leak continues to provoke public protest and legal action as candidates demand a fair examination process.
newTitle: Supreme Court Dismisses Plea Against Bihar PSC Exam Amid Paper Leak Allegations

title: Oscars 2025: Suriya’s ‘Kanguva’ joins 6 other Indian films in the contenders’ list, fans surprised - The Hindu
summary:
Oscars 2025: Suriya’s ‘Kanguva’ joins 6 other Indian films in the contenders’ list, fans surprised

Date: January 07, 2025

Source: The Hindu

Suriya’s big-budget film Kanguva, which opened to mixed responses after its release on November 14, 2024, has made it to the contenders list of Oscars 2025. Directed by Siva, the movie is an action adventure also starring Bobby Deol and Disha Patani.

  • Despite mixed reviews, Suriya's performance in Kanguva received praise, while many criticized the film's execution.
  • Jyothika, Suriya’s wife, commented that the negative reactions felt like propaganda.
  • In addition to Kanguva, other Indian films in the running include Girls will be Girls, Santosh, Swatantrya Veer Savarkar, All We Imagine as Light, Putul, and Aadujeevitham: The Goat Life.
  • The voting for nominations will occur from January 8 to January 12, 2025, with the final list announced on January 17, 2025.
“The Oscars will be held on March 02, 2025, at the Dolby Theatre in Ovation Hollywood.”

In brief, Suriya's Kanguva has captivated fans and made waves by joining the contenders for the Oscars 2025, despite mixed reviews.
newTitle: Oscars 2025: Suriya’s ‘Kanguva’ joins 6 other Indian films in the contenders’ list, fans surprised

title: One Mobikwik Systems shares climb over 14% after Q2 results announcement | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
One Mobikwik Systems Shares Surge 14% Following Q2 Earnings Release

Date: January 7, 2024 | Source: Live Mint

MobiKwik shares experienced a significant rise following the announcement of its Q2 earnings, marking a milestone for the company post-IPO.

The share price climbed 14 percent to ₹638 on January 7, 2024, following the earnings announcement for the quarter ending September 2024. This was MobiKwik's first quarterly results release since its market debut in December 2024.

  • MobiKwik's share price is now 129% above its IPO issue price of ₹279.
  • The company reported a net loss of ₹3.5 crore for Q2, down from a profit of ₹5.2 crore in the same period last year.
  • Operational revenue increased by 43% year-on-year, reaching ₹291 crore.
  • Investments are focused on driving growth despite the incurred losses.
  • MobiKwik serves 161 million registered users and has a merchant network of 4.3 million.
MobiKwik commands a 23.11% market share in India’s PPI wallet segment as of May 2024.

In conclusion, despite current losses, MobiKwik continues to show strong growth potential and adapt its strategies to capture the digital payment market in India.
newTitle: One Mobikwik Systems Shares Surge 14% Following Q2 Earnings Release

title: Suriya-Bobby Deol's box-office bomb Kanguva enters Oscars 2025 race with Girls will be Girls, All We Imagine as Light - Hindustan Times
summary:
Suriya and Bobby Deol-starrer Kanguva, one of the biggest box-office failures of 2024, is a top contender at Oscars 2025

Date: Jan 07, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

One of the most awaited Indian films of 2024 was Siruthai Siva’s directorial Kanguva. Although it underperformed at the box office, it has surprisingly entered the Oscars 2025 race.

  • Despite significant expectations, Kanguva earned only ₹106 crore against its ₹300-350 crore budget.
  • Kanguva is competing for the Oscars against critically acclaimed films like Girls Will Be Girls and All We Imagine as Light.
  • Out of 323 eligible films for the 97th Academy Awards, 6 are Indian, including Kanguva.
“Why has Kanguva, a box-office bomb, made it to this esteemed list?”

The news has sparked curiosity among netizens questioning Kanguva's nomination considering its commercial failure.
newTitle: Suriya-Bobby Deol's Kanguva Surprises as Oscars 2025 Contender

title: Nvidia launches RTX 50 series GPUs at CES 2025: See prices, specs, AI features, other details - Hindustan Times
summary:
Nvidia Unveils RTX 50 Series GPUs at CES 2025

Date: January 7, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Nvidia has launched its new RTX 50-series graphics cards at CES 2025, promising significant upgrades in performance and efficiency for PC gamers.

Key Points:

  • The RTX 50-series GPUs feature performance enhancements, efficiency improvements, and a sleek redesign.
  • The top-tier RTX 5090 boasts twice the performance of the RTX 4090, suitable for smaller PC cases.
  • Specs of RTX 5090: 32GB GDDR7 memory, 21,760 CUDA cores, 1,792GB/sec bandwidth.
  • Mid-range models RTX 5070 Ti and RTX 5070 offer double the performance of their predecessors.
  • Nvidia's new GPUs support advanced AI features like DLSS 4 and Neural Shaders.
  • Prices range from $549 for the RTX 5070 to $1,999 for the RTX 5090.

Notable Quotes:

“These GPUs are likely to become highly sought after, especially for PC gamers.”

The RTX 50-series GPUs for laptops will launch in March 2025.

Conclusion:

The RTX 50-series represents Nvidia's continued commitment to leading the graphics technology market, emphasizing performance, efficiency, and innovative AI features.
newTitle: Nvidia Unveils RTX 50 Series GPUs at CES 2025

Samsung has announced that its flagship hardware launch event, Galaxy Unpacked 2025, will take place on January 22 in San Jose.

title: Theatre actor Alok Chatterjee dies, Swanand Kirkire remembers Irrfan Khan's NSD batchmate: Ek nayaab abhineta chala gaya - Hindustan Times
summary:
Theatre Actor Alok Chatterjee Passes Away, Remembered by Swanand Kirkire

Date: Jan 07, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Alok Chatterjee, a renowned theatre actor and gold medalist from the National School of Drama, passed away on January 6, 2025. His last rites are scheduled to be held on January 7. He was a prominent figure in Indian theatre and a beloved friend of late actor Irrfan Khan.

  • Alok Chatterjee died due to multiple organ failure at the age of 64.
  • Swanand Kirkire shared a heartfelt note on Instagram, remembering Alok as a unique actor.
  • Alok was a gold medalist at the National School of Drama (NSD) and directed several significant plays.
  • He was known for his contributions to Indian cinema and theatre, having taught at NSD and FTII.
“Alok Chatterjee.. ek nayaab abhineta chala gaya! Woh NSD mein Irrfan ke batchmate the (A unique actor is gone! He was Irfan's batchmate in NSD.)” - Swanand Kirkire

Alok Chatterjee's death marks a great loss for the theatre community, reflecting the profound impact he had on his colleagues and students alike.
newTitle: Theatre Actor Alok Chatterjee Passes Away, Remembered by Swanand Kirkire

title: Prashant Kishor hospitalised, says his fast unto death ‘will continue’ - The Hindu
summary:
Prashant Kishor hospitalised, says his fast unto death ‘will continue’

Published on: January 07, 2025 01:37 pm IST
Source: The Hindu

Jan Suraaj Party founder Prashant Kishor was hospitalised suffering from dehydration after being previously arrested for a fast unto death protesting the Bihar Public Service Commission exams.

  • Kishor was found to be suffering from dehydration and infection.
  • He was taken to a healthcare facility in Patna after medical advice.
  • Despite his condition, he declared that his fast unto death would continue.
  • He began the hunger strike on January 2 and was arrested on January 6.
  • The fast is part of a protest against alleged irregularities in the BPSC exams.
"My fast unto death will continue" - Prashant Kishor

The situation surrounding Prashant Kishor illustrates the ongoing protests regarding the BPSC exams and significant public engagement in the issue.
newTitle: Prashant Kishor hospitalised, claims his fast unto death will continue

title: Where Is Atul Subhash's Son? Nikita Singhania's Lawyer Replies In Top Court - NDTV
summary:
Court's 'Stranger' Remark As Atul Subhash's Mother Seeks Grandson's Custody

Publication Date: Recent, Source: Not specified

In a custody battle concerning AI techie Atul Subhash's four-year-old son, his estranged wife, Nikita Singhania, revealed to the Supreme Court that the child is currently in a boarding school in Faridabad, Haryana. Following Atul's tragic suicide in December, his mother Anju Devi is seeking custody.

  • Atul Subhash took his own life after accusing Nikita of harassment.
  • Nikita's family is facing abetment to suicide charges.
  • The Supreme Court directed that the child be produced in the next hearing.
  • Concerns raised about the child's unfamiliarity with his grandmother.
  • The custody issue is to be decided in the appropriate court.
“Sorry to say but the child is a stranger to the petitioner,” remarked Justice Nagaratna.

The next hearing is scheduled for January 20.
newTitle: Court's 'Stranger' Remark in Custody Battle of Atul Subhash's Son

title: Delhi Assembly Elections 2025 Date Announcement Live Updates: Schedule To Be Released Shortly - NDTV
Supreme Court Grants Interim Bail To Asaram Bapu In Rape Case For Medical Treatment - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Grants Interim Bail To Asaram Bapu In Rape Case For Medical Treatment

Publication Date: January 7
Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court has granted interim bail to self-styled godman Asaram Bapu, who is serving a life sentence in a rape case, allowing him to seek medical treatment until March 31, 2025.

  • The bail was granted by Justices M.M. Sundresh and Rajesh Bindal, with a condition that Asaram must not meet his followers while released.
  • Asaram's legal team argued his health condition justified the need for bail, citing his advanced age and history of heart problems.
  • The Solicitor General opposed the bail, stating Asaram has adequate medical care in jail.
  • The bail was issued on humanitarian grounds, with the court allowing for a reassessment of Asaram's medical status closer to the end of the bail period.
  • The original conviction involved multiple charges of rape and other serious offenses against a female disciple.
“The relief was granted solely on humanitarian grounds.”

This decision allows Asaram to undergo necessary medical treatment while under specific conditions imposed by the court.
newTitle: Supreme Court Grants Interim Bail To Asaram Bapu In Rape Case For Medical Treatment

title: Elon Musk Asks If US Should "Liberate" UK From "Tyrannical Government" - NDTV
Elon Musk Asks If US Should "Liberate" UK From "Tyrannical Government" - NDTV
Rape Convict Asaram Bapu Gets Interim Bail, But Can't Meet His Followers - NDTV
summary:
Asaram Granted Interim Bail by Supreme Court Despite Rape Convictions

Date: Recent news from Source: NDTV

A week after self-styled godman Asaram returned to jail from a previous parole, the Supreme Court has granted him interim bail on medical grounds in a 2013 rape case. However, he will remain incarcerated as he seeks bail in another case.

  • Asaram, 83, was convicted for raping a teenager in his Jodhpur ashram in 2013.
  • He has been sentenced to life imprisonment for the crime.
  • The court granted bail until March 31, with restrictions on meeting followers.
  • Police are instructed to escort him only for medical treatment.
  • Asaram's lawyers cited serious medical ailments in their request for bail.
Asaram is suffering from serious medical ailments.

The court's decision reflects ongoing legal proceedings amid his multiple convictions.
newTitle: Asaram Granted Interim Bail by Supreme Court Despite Rape Convictions
